correct_order: In the summer of 1992, the first year I became president of XYZ, I decided to take a two-week vacation.
But as soon I arrived at my country house, the telephone began ringing
And it kept right on ringing with questions from people back at the office about the most mundane matters
Of course, sitting out in the country I possessed less information than anyone else at headquarters about was going on, but they called me anyway

sources: But as soon I arrived at my country house, the telephone began ringing
And it kept right on ringing with questions from people back at the office about the most mundane matters
In the summer of 1992, the first year I became president of XYZ, I decided to take a two-week vacation.
Of course, sitting out in the country I possessed less information than anyone else at headquarters about was going on, but they called me anyway
